verses.kjv: And Abram went up out of Egypt, he, and his wife, and all that he had, and Lot with him, into the south.
verses.ct: So Abram left Egypt and headed to the Negev region, bringing his wife, everything he owned, and Lot with him.

verses.kjv: And Abram was very rich in cattle, in silver, and in gold.
verses.ct: Abram had become extremely wealthy, with large herds of livestock, silver, and gold.

verses.kjv: And he went on his journeys from the south even to Bethel, unto the place where his tent had been at the beginning, between Bethel and Hai;
verses.ct: He traveled by stages from the Negev all the way back to Bethel, to the spot between Bethel and Hai where he had previously camped.

verses.kjv: Unto the place of the altar, which he had made there at the first: and there Abram called on the name of the LORD.
verses.ct: This was the location of the altar he had built earlier, and there Abram worshiped the LORD.

verses.kjv: And Lot also, which went with Abram, had flocks, and herds, and tents.
verses.ct: Lot, who had been traveling with Abram, also owned flocks, herds, and tents.

verses.kjv: And the land was not able to bear them, that they might dwell together: for their substance was great, so that they could not dwell together.
verses.ct: But the land couldn't support both of them living in the same area. They had accumulated so much that it was impossible for them to stay together.

verses.kjv: And there was a strife between the herdmen of Abram’s cattle and the herdmen of Lot’s cattle: and the Canaanite and the Perizzite dwelled then in the land.
verses.ct: Conflict broke out between Abram's herders and Lot's herders. At that time, the Canaanites and Perizzites were also living in the region.

verses.kjv: And Abram said unto Lot, Let there be no strife, I pray thee, between me and thee, and between my herdmen and thy herdmen; for we be brethren.
verses.ct: Abram said to Lot, "Please, let's not have any conflict between you and me, or between your herders and mine. After all, we're family."

verses.kjv: Is not the whole land before thee? separate thyself, I pray thee, from me: if thou wilt take the left hand, then I will go to the right; or if thou depart to the right hand, then I will go to the left.
verses.ct: "The entire land is right in front of you. Let's go our separate ways. If you head left, I'll go right. If you go right, I'll head left."

verses.kjv: And Lot lifted up his eyes, and beheld all the plain of Jordan, that it was well watered every where, before the LORD destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah, even as the garden of the LORD, like the land of Egypt, as thou comest unto Zoar.
verses.ct: Lot looked out and saw the whole Jordan Valley, and how well-watered it was everywhere. This was before the LORD destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah — the valley was like the LORD's own garden, like the land of Egypt all the way toward Zoar.

verses.kjv: Then Lot chose him all the plain of Jordan; and Lot journeyed east: and they separated themselves the one from the other.
verses.ct: So Lot chose the entire Jordan Valley for himself and headed east. That's how the two of them parted ways.

verses.kjv: Abram dwelled in the land of Canaan, and Lot dwelled in the cities of the plain, and pitched his tent toward Sodom.
verses.ct: Abram stayed in the land of Canaan, while Lot settled among the cities of the valley and set up camp near Sodom.

verses.kjv: But the men of Sodom were wicked and sinners before the LORD exceedingly.
verses.ct: The people of Sodom, however, were extremely wicked and deeply sinful against the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Abram, after that Lot was separated from him, Lift up now thine eyes, and look from the place where thou art northward, and southward, and eastward, and westward:
verses.ct: After Lot had gone, the LORD said to Abram, "Look up from where you are standing and gaze in every direction — north, south, east, and west."

verses.kjv: For all the land which thou seest, to thee will I give it, and to thy seed for ever.
verses.ct: "All the land that you can see, I am giving to you and your descendants permanently."

verses.kjv: And I will make thy seed as the dust of the earth: so that if a man can number the dust of the earth, then shall thy seed also be numbered.
verses.ct: "I will make your descendants as countless as the dust of the earth — if anyone could count every speck of dust, only then could they count your descendants."

verses.kjv: Arise, walk through the land in the length of it and in the breadth of it; for I will give it unto thee.
verses.ct: "Get up and walk across the entire land, both its length and its width, because I am giving it to you."

verses.kjv: Then Abram removed his tent, and came and dwelt in the plain of Mamre, which is in Hebron, and built there an altar unto the LORD.
verses.ct: So Abram moved his camp and went to live at the oaks of Mamre in Hebron, where he built an altar to the LORD.
